title: George.Stevens.D.Day.To.Berlin.XviD.AC3..avi
description:
Think of World War II Europe and black-and-white newsreel images likely come to mind. But the war unfolded in color. And that&#039;s how Academy Award-winning director George Stevens (A Place in the Sun, Giant) captured it in this acclaimed compilation of the personal wartime diary he filmed while on the front life. George Stevens, Jr. produces and narrates this triple Emmy-winning look at the world at war. From the Normandy invasion to the East-West link-up of troops at the Elbe, from the excitement and danger of the liberation of Paris to the horror of Dachau, the elder Stevens filmed these moments and much more in reels augmented and in amazing color George Stevens: D-Day to Berlin is a rare document of history as it happened.
